subject: linear_algebra
title: Dot Product Theorem
contentHtml:
The dot product of two vectors is a fundamental concept in linear algebra that has numerous applications in machine learning and artificial intelligence.

In essence, it measures the amount of 'similarity' between two vectors.
name: Dot Product
proofSketch: The proof involves expanding the dot product in terms of the magnitudes and cosine of the angle between the vectors, then simplifying to arrive at the desired formula." },
intuition: The dot product measures the amount of 'similarity' between two vectors by considering their magnitude (length) and the angle between them. Vectors with a small angle between them will have a large dot product, while orthogonal vectors will have a dot product of zero.
realWorldApplications: Measuring similarity between data points in clustering algorithms

subject: linear_algebra
title: Dot Product Theorem
contentHtml:
The dot product, also known as the inner product, is a fundamental concept in linear algebra.

Given two vectors \mathbf{a} and \mathbf{b}, their dot product \mathbf{a} \cdot \mathbf{b} measures the amount of 'similarity' between them.

",
latex: \( \mathbf{a} \cdot \mathbf{b} = a_1 b_1 + a_2 b_2 + \cdots + a_n b_n \)
name: Dot Product Formula" },
proofSketch: The proof involves expanding the dot product formula and recognizing the geometric interpretation as the product of magnitudes times the cosine of the angle between the vectors." },
intuition: The dot product theorem shows that the dot product is proportional to the product of the magnitudes of the two vectors, with the proportionality constant being the cosine of the angle between them. This has important implications for machine learning and artificial intelligence applications.
realWorldApplications: Measuring similarity between data points in clustering algorithms
